div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Apr. 13 1897. A LETTER OF THANKS

body.p: Sincere thanks are expressed to all priests, to all Societies of St. Stanislauz Kostka's, St. Hedwig's, St. Hyacinth's, Holy Trinity, and St. Michael the Archangel's parishes, and to all the guests who took part in the solemn ceremony of the blessing of the bells of St. John Cautius' parish on Sunday, April 11. May God bless the parents of those who acted as godmothers and godfathers of the bells. After the Easter holiday special services will be held as a means of expressing our thanks, first to God for blessing us with such a beautiful Sunday for this affair, second to the parents of the children who acted as godfathers and godmothers, and third, to all who took part in the event.

In order to anticipate inquries the following information is given. The largest bell, St. Anne, weighs 5785 pounds and cost $ 1157.20. The second bell, St. John the Raptist, weighs 2841 pounds and cost $578.20. The third bell,
St. Hedwig, cost $357.80 and weighs 1889 pounds. Cost of all the mountings for all three bells amounted to $287.00, making the total cost of the bells $2370.20.

Where did the members of the parish get this money? People of good will always have something to contribute toward a good cause. The following societies and brotherhoods of St. John Cautius' parish made donations:

row.cell: 6. St. King Casimir Young Men's Society
10. St. Adalbert Bishop and Martyr Society
14. St. Ignaties Bishop and Martyr Society

body.p: The following donations came from St. Michael the Archangel's Parish:
The St. Hyacinth Society of St. Hyacinth's parish contributed $5, and the Jacob Weyer Society of St. Stanislaus Kostka's parish $10.
A collection taken from the parents of the children who acted as godfathers and godmothers brougat $500, and a collection taken in the church brought $300.
May God bless all those who have make these contributions for the new bells.
In the name of the parish,
John Kasprzycki, C.R., pastor of St. John Cautius' parish

P. S. The bells were safely placed in the tower yesterday. This work was under contract to P. Radlowsai. With the gracious permission of the Blessed mother the new bells will ring for the first time this evening in their proper place and will call the pious to evening prayer.
